Package dt.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • dt.model.Board
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClientBoard, ServerBoard
    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    Emiel Rous and Wouter Koning This class is the class that stores all the board data and houses all the logic for the game.

      • randomNumber

        public static int randomNumber​(int min,
                               int max)
        Creates a random int between a minimum and a maximum, given to the method. This uses Math.random().
        Parameters:
        min - The lowest value it is allowed to be.
        max - The highest value it is allowed to be.
        Returns:
        A random int value such that min <= return <= max

      • getBoardSize

      • fillBoard

        public void fillBoard​(int[] newBoard)
        Fills the board given an integer array. It fills the board with rows and columns, which are both of the Sequence class.
        Parameters:
        newBoard -

      • makeMove

        public java.util.HashMap<BallType,​java.lang.Integer> makeMove​(Move move)
                                                             throws InvalidMoveException
        The method that is responsible for proper handling and executing of moves. This method runs past a whole lot of other functions that together make a legal and valid move on the board.
        Parameters:
        move - The Move that is wanted to be made on the board.
        Returns:
        The yield that the board gives after making a move.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - When the move made is not a valid move.
        requires
        the parameter given to not be null.
        ensures
        oldBoard != newBoard., that the balls removed from the board are returned., No more than boardsize * (boardsize - 1) coloured balls can ever be present in a game.

      • executeMove

        public void executeMove​(int move)
        Executes a move on the board that is provided in the parameter of the function
        Parameters:
        move - The move to be executed, conform the protocol.
        requires
        The parameter given to the method to be a move that is conform protocol (0 <= move <= 27), The parameter given to the method to be a move that is possible given the current board
        ensures
        oldboard != newboard., rows and columns are synchronized again after a move has been performed.

      • synchronize

        public void synchronize​(java.util.List<Sequence> upToDateList,
                        java.util.List<Sequence> outdatedList)
        A method which synchronizes the rows and columns that this board holds.
        Parameters:
        upToDateList - The List that has been changed
        outdatedList - The List that has not been changed and thus needs changing
        ensures
        rows and columns are synchronized again after a move has been performed.

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(Move move)
                    throws InvalidMoveException
        Finds out whether the move passed to the method is a move that is valid. It does this by checking whether the move is legal via Move.isLegal(), after which it checks whether it is either a valid single move via findValidSingleMoves() if the parameter given is a single move. If the parameter given is a double move, it first checks whether a single move was possible or not. If not, it goes to find whether findValidDoubleMoves() returns a move that is equal to the parameter..
        Parameters:
        move - The move to be checked for whether it is valid or not.
        Returns:
        The validity of the move.
        Throws:
        InvalidMoveException - If the move you tried to make is a double move, but a single move is possible.
        InvalidMoveException - If the move is a move that is not conform protocol.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

      • findValidMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> findValidMoves()
        A method which returns all valid moves possible. It only returns a List of single moves or double moves, but not one containing both. If there are no single moves available, it returns a list of double moves.
        Returns:
        A list of the moves which are valid on the current board.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

      • findValidDoubleMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> findValidDoubleMoves()
        A method which returns a list of all valid double moves.
        Returns:
        A List of valid double moves.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

      • findValidSingleMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> findValidSingleMoves()
        A method which returns a list of all valid single moves.
        Returns:
        A List of valid single moves.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

      • findPossibleMoves

        public java.util.List<Move> findPossibleMoves()
        A method that finds the moves that are possible to do. Though, the return value of this is not per say the moves that are valid. This method only finds the moves that are possible on a single move.
        Returns:
        A List, indicating the moves that are possible given the current board state.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

      • getYield

        public java.util.HashMap<BallType,​java.lang.Integer> getYield()
        Go over all rows and columns and find the type and amount of balls that lie next to each other and then remove those from the board.
        Returns:
        a HashMap with as key the BallType, and as value the amount of balls the move yielded.
        ensures
        oldBoard != newboard.

      • calculateBallCoordinates

        public int calculateBallCoordinates​(java.util.List<Sequence> sequenceList,
                                    int sequenceNum,
                                    int elementNum)
        Calculates the coordinates of the ball, given a List, what number in the list, and what element.
        Parameters:
        sequenceList - A List, which is either this.rows or this.columns.
        sequenceNum - The sequence index of the List.
        elementNum - The element index of the sequence.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the elementNum in sequenceNum, in the sequenceList.

      • sameBallsInSequence

        public int sameBallsInSequence​(Sequence sequence,
                               int index,
                               int ballSequence)
        Recursively calculated how many of the same balls are found after each other in a Sequence, given an index.
        Parameters:
        sequence - The sequence in which to look for similar balls.
        index - The index of the element to be looking at in the sequence and from which to be finding equal elements.
        ballSequence - The amount of balls found that are the same in the sequence
        Returns:
        The amount of balls found that are the same in the sequence
        requires
        The index given to the method to not be negative.
        ensures
        The board is not changed.

        A method which returns the board state in the form of an int.

        An int which contains the board state.

        Returns:
        Whether the game is over or not.
